name: Rydges World Square Sydney Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just stayed at this hotel for the weekend. Nice 2 night stay.
reviews.title: Nice stay and Great Location!

reviews.text: Hotel is in great location. We took the train from the airport and got off at the station nearest the hotel - only a 2 minute walk and there it was. Chinatown just down the road. Darling harbour just 5 minutes walk. Monorail right outside the door and train station 2 blocks away - what more could you want. We booked an executive room with access to executive lounge for breakfast and night time nibbles and drinks. Check in on arrival was fast and effiecient. The room was on the 19th floor and very quiet and had everything that is expected. The breakfast at the executive lounge was more than adequate with selection of drinks, toast, cereals, fruit, pastries etc.......and appears they have taken on board a previous review re waiting for cutlery etc as it is now on the table ready and waiting. The nibbles and drinks were also nice (although the first night the lounge was full - but we were directed straight down to the lobby bar, where on our arrival we were greeted and given drinks of our choice and nibbles). This was a good place to sit and people watch.......so we did not mind at all. The staff in all departments are friendly and the taxi we ordered the night before for a very early morning pick-up arrived on time.
reviews.title: Pretty poor and expensive! I think the general manager needs glasses!!

likes.disliked: — not worth the money, poor service at reception, NOT A 5 STAR AS ADVERTISED!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For location and value I would stay here again for sure.
reviews.title: Positively Average
Not too bad, but could have been a LOT better! Don't pay the rack rate!!!
reviews.text: PS: The 'dream' bed - is 'dreamy', and the pillows are like sleeping on clouds.......
This is the second Rydges hotel we stayed in, the first was the one at Cronulla. The Cronulla Rydges was excellent, this place........ well.........
reviews.title: Great Location at a Great Price

reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights on business. The staff 'greeted you' but didn't look like they cared less that you were staying there. Move over there was the greeting I got when I arrived at the reception. The staff looked and sounded like backpackers in uniform and just there for a paycheck.
reviews.title: Just ok.. Business hotel with business like staff, no warmth or friendliness and the WORST breakfast ever!!!

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is good.
reviews.title: Great Accomodation

reviews.text: The lobby area is nice as are all the public areas.
reviews.title: Fabulous location, very comfortable

reviews.text: The rooms are ok. Just average and not what you would expect for the money.
reviews.title: Completely average and overpriced

reviews.text: No wifi in your room, even if you are paying stupid prices to connect to the Internet.
reviews.title: Very comfortable hotel with excellent staff

reviews.text: I travel to Sydney frequently and Rydges World Square is currently my home away from home (until I get bored and need to mix it up a bit). Its good quality, reasonably priced and in a good lively location. My business finishes at about 9pm and so I like that I can check in then pop out for sushi or other light meal, get the feeling that I have been somewhere other than work, and then go to bed. If I finish a bit early I can even squeeze in a tiny bit of shopping in the plaza just under the hotel.
reviews.title: my home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just recently stayed at the World Square Hotel Rydges in Sydney
reviews.title: Loved the decor, it was modern & welcoming.

reviews.text: and I was very impressed with the pleasantness and attention
reviews.title: EXCELLENT STAY

likes.liked: — LOCATION AND FRIENDLY STAFF AND YOU COULD OPEN WINDOWS IN ROOM

reviews.text: we received. We only stayed in the basic room and it was very
reviews.title: Beware the beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: nice with comfortable beds and all you need for an overnight stay.
reviews.title: Dream Bed, NOT!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is probably one of the worst hotels we have stayed in. Customer service is zero. Upon check in I asked the desk the fastest way to get to Circular Quay, and after looking at my map he said "just walk". This is at least a 30 minute brisk walk. On our own we figured out the transportation. There is even a free bus that runs during the day. The staff were clueless in recommending restaurants. locations of major sights and where to buy certain items. I asked for a quiet room on a high floor. We most likely got the noisiest room in the hotel on a low floor. Their floor numbering is deceiving. It starts at 10, when in actuality this is the first floor. If you get a room on Pitt St it is directly across the street from a night club that stays open on the weekend until 2:30AM. People were screaming and hanging out the windows and the music was so loud it shook the windows. When I called the desk at 12:30AM to see if we could change roooms his reply was "you can come down for some earplugs!". This hotel caters to airline personnel and I'm sure they are placed in a quiet section, if there is one. The self laundry has a dryer that isn't vented, so your clothers never get dried and the whole room is wet from the steam. Sydney is a beautiful city and there are many good hotels. If you want to enjoy yourself and get a restful nights sleep, I would advise not staying at the Rydges.
reviews.title: Worst stay ever!

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the Rydges World Square Hotel and we found it very clean the room and bathroom were a nice size, but I really recommend the beds, the king bed was so comfortable as were the pillows. It is very central to all the shops and just a short walk from the chinese gardens, cockle bay and Darling Harbour. I f you don't mind a longer walk, you can go down to the Rocks and Circular Quay also the Sydney Opera house and Sydney Harbour Bridge, it is quite a long walk but a pleasant walk. Also the best part there is a very nice cafe around the corner called Mama Rosa's the breakfast was delicious.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: I stayed here on December 4th. I arrived at about 7 am in the morning after spending the night on the train. I dropped my bags off and then went and got breakfast. My daughter and I had travelled all night and had barely slept. I called and asked if we could check in early and the lady took my number and said she would call as soon as a room was ready. I was called half an hour later and allowed to check in early at no cost. The rooms were clean and tidy and the service was amazing. Would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Awesome service, amazing staff!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a higher room on a non-smoking level
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.text: Only stayed overnight
reviews.title: Tired rooms, with some excellent front office staff

reviews.text: Warm and friendly hotel. Nice rooms with everything you would want. Reception busy so you may have a short wait but its not a problem. Handy to most things although the walk to Town Hall Station in the rain is a bit of a pain.
reviews.title: Great stay - lovely hotel

reviews.text: I've stayed here a couple of times and always find the rooms well maintained, clean and staff helpful. I find it very central in the city and near many things. But my view has changed slightly and this is now my 2nd fav hotel as i just stayed at The Grace after a 2 night stay at the Rydges and i find the position of the Grace better, even though theyr both CBD central i find that Rydges is too close to the China town side ( so this is great if thats what you're after) but the old world charm of the Grace was more appealing to my partner and I, But that's just us. I would still recommend Rydges ( i would only stay here on one of the wotif/lastminute deals). The breaky was great for myself and my daughter a full american breaky was way enough for 2 : )
reviews.title: Good hotel but prefer The Grace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Staff, very friendly . Spotless, close to everywhere, Can't say enough good things about it. Would love to come back soon
reviews.title: Perfect Location!!~

reviews.text: Our family had stayed Rydges World square for the second time last weekend. Great and helpful front office staff and quick valet parking service as always. Great location for family stay, good value for money. Clean and spacious family room and comfortable bed. We definately will come back for next trip to Sydney.
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.text: We usually stay at this hotel whenever we are in Sydney simply because the beds are great! I don't know if they are latex or just normal spring mattresses but the beds are very comfortable.
reviews.title: good location, good beds!

reviews.text: We stayed at Rydges with our 2 children over the weekend.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel for families!!!

reviews.text: The room was big and the kids had lots of room to play. As a mum of young children I liked to have both a bath and a shower in the bathroom. We also liked to have a television in each room.
reviews.title: Poor Service, Smelly rooms, zero care factor - a disgrace

reviews.text: The beds were the best I have ever slept in, and the room was quiet.
reviews.title: Very average indeed

reviews.text: Easy access in and out of the hotel with the pram, high chairs are available in the
reviews.title: Great stay !

reviews.text: restaurant and kids are welcome for dinner!
reviews.title: Very comfortable bed, quiet rooms

reviews.text: our family needed a night out and was greeted with friendly, pleasant and helpful staffs. our family had a great night out and the service of the hotel capped the experience. thank you again and we will be back soon...
reviews.title: Friendly and Pleasant staff

reviews.text: I stayed at Rydges World Square for 3 nights, and it was adequate to say the least. Finding the place is a little confusing as there are multiple entrances, and the street entrances aren't immediately obvious. The receptionists were a little muddled in trying to find my booking.
reviews.title: Adequate

reviews.text: Rooms are average in size and the beds are comfortable and bathroom clean.
reviews.title: A great hotel, let down by room service

reviews.text: Breakfast was a little disappointing; you'd be better off seeking out a cafe in the surrounding streets. Darling Harbour is about 10mins walk, and the hotel is on George Street, which is the main (and seedy, and dirty) thoroughfare of Central Sydney.
reviews.title: Great overnight at Rydges

reviews.text: Overall, it wasn't impressive, neither disappointing.
reviews.title: central, comfortable and clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had read a couple of reviews of the great beds in this hotel but that must only be in the executive suites because ours was horrible! Worst sleep of our entire holiday which was very unfortuante because I had specifically chosen this hotel to relax in and have a good sleep after travelling to Sydney from Canada. The rooms was dated and in need of a lift, particularly the bathroom. The location was decent enough, it's a bit of a walk to the Quay and the Rocks but that was fine for us. The hotel was just OK....if I was staying in Sydney again I would defintiely pick a different hotel.
reviews.title: Overall Disappointing

reviews.text: I stayed here for a week over New Year 08/09. I had mixed feelings in the beginning, but I was pleasantly surprised after reading "so many negative" reviews. I had a Executive King room. It was a bit noisy cause of the windows not really eating the noise from the outside air conditions, but I had worse.
reviews.title: Was impressed..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed the stay and the location makes it unbeatable. It was not my first stay in Sydney, and will definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Ideally located but unfortunate experience

reviews.text: It was clean, staff very friendly, check in was quick and painless, even for that time window.
reviews.title: Exceptionally Well Trained Staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything is reachable with in 15 minutes, Opera in 20min.
reviews.title: Terrific hotel close to everything

reviews.text: World Square hotel is in a brilliant location, so easy to get anywhere from there. The rooms are great and the staff look after you very well. They will assist with anything you want and nothing is a bother. Very highly recommended.
reviews.title: Very helpful staff, great location

reviews.text: Very average hotel. Think the rating is definitely not 4.5*. More 3.5*.
reviews.title: More 3.5 than 4.5 star

reviews.text: Good location, ten minutes walk from either Central Railway station or Town Hall station.
reviews.title: Does the job but nothing special

reviews.text: Nice public areas. The rooms are very basic. My room was also quite dark as the window literally had a view of the back of another building.
reviews.title: Good location & family friendly service

reviews.text: Un-impressed with the breakfast. Its not cheap and the offering are very limited. No eggs made to order, not even any cold cuts of meats and cheeses.
reviews.title: Brilliant Location - Lovely staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: absolutely enjoyed my sydney trip cuz we stayed at rydges world square that has such a good location!! world square shopping mall is just below with so many shops to see. coles is also just downstairs! 5 min walk to chinatown and 15 min walk to darling harbour. just right next to pitt street that has amazing korean food and of course a bit further is pitt street mall and queen victoria building. george st is just in front, many restaurants, starbucks, fast food conveniently located within 1km.
reviews.title: location

reviews.text: Room size might be a bit small but sufficient nonetheless. hotel staff were friendly and concierge helped to call our taxi and keep our bags after check out as we only left to the airport later that day.
reviews.title: Great location but noisy at weekends.

reviews.text: we stayed over a weekend .There are two all night venues close by pumping out mega loud "music" which went until 5.30am on Saturday and Sunday .Chinese water torture had nothing on this!! I believe that there is some quiet rooms so be sure to request one.Arrived early so we dropped our two carry on bags and headed for Chinatown for some lunch after being informed "after 2pm". Returning at 2.30pm we were told our room was not ready yet? in by 2pm out by 11am ? so we fully expected to pick up entry cards and that our luggage had already been taken to our rooms. Reading other reviews it would appear that there is a problem with this .yup...Excellent beds !!
reviews.title: Well located, friendly, clean and luxourious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the Rydges World Square for four nights. The hotel is located about 10 mins walk from Darling Harbour and about 15 minutes from Sydney Harbour. The staff were very helpful, the hotel was clean and situated in the middle of many bars and restaurants. The Sydney monorail is situated next to the hotel, with a stop.
reviews.title: 8 out of 10 - would stay again

reviews.text: Our second stay here due to location,discounted rate and late check-out (1pm) on Rydges club membership (free to join). Stayed over a very busy long weekend (Queens Birthday Jubilee) - booked early and got a good rate. The hotel was very busy that weekend so a wait at times but staff friendly and helpful. I would stay again.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Concierge guys were great and they knew pretty much everything about Sydney, but breakfast and service was just about average. Location of the hotel is excellent - bang in the middle of the city and most places are around !
reviews.title: Excellent Location - Very Average Service !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid AU$1150- for a room for four nights that had mold in the bathroom and shower, traces of blood on the tiles, cracked tiles, food fragments in the mouth- piece of the telephone.
reviews.title: Terrible, tired and dirty room ...Rydges Priority Club Guest !!

reviews.text: ..... This Not acceptable at any hotel.
reviews.title: Great location, average service, comfy beds, nice & clean rooms!

reviews.text: Don't stay here!
reviews.title: More like 3 star than 4.5

reviews.text: The room was tired and dingy with no views,
reviews.title: A dreadful hotel in a beautiful city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rydges World Square is a nice place to be in. The location is gud... Monorail at ur doorstep, tourist spots like Hyde park, sydney tower, darling harbour at walking distance...I even walked up to the SCG....I checked in at World Sq after my 5day stay with another Rydges Hotel : Gold Coast Intnl....So I was expecting 4-5 star luxuries, and I must say that I wasnt disappointed......
reviews.title: Liked the Location

likes.disliked: — I cud hav added bfast to my package

reviews.text: Only thing I cud hav done better was to ensure that I get b/fast with my room......which I had in GCI but not at World Square...But that wasnt a problem as Coles (a supermart) and many many rest. are right besides the hOtel....
reviews.title: Very enjoyable 4-day stay

reviews.text: Final word: Go for it, superb value for money.
reviews.title: So close to getting a reasonable review!!

likes.disliked: — Apathetic staff in restaurant & ridiculous Amex surcharge.

reviews.text: I am amazed at the quantity of negative reviews published about the Rydges World Square. I spent 4 nights in this hotel (Nov 28 to Dec 2, 2008) and had a very enjoyable stay and positive experience for my very first time in Australia. For €100 (approx AU$200) on average per night in an upscale, centrally located hotel, I am convinced I made a good deal.
reviews.title: Is this Fawlty Towers?

reviews.text: Very nice rooms, spacious and convenient, clean and tastefully furnished. Not sure if the hotel is a 3 1/2 or 4 stars but they are well deserved. Location is perfect, short walk to Darling Harbour and close to all downtown shopping centers and food courts. I came from the Sydney airport with all my luggage using the train, and had only a couple hundred meters to walk from the Museum station.
reviews.title: Shocking post-stay service

description: Rydges World Square Sydney is centrally located on the corner of Pitt and Liverpool Streets, within the World Square shopping and business precinct in the CBD. This great contemporary hotel has a fantastic location with easy access to Sydney's major shopping areas, theatres and tourist attractions like Darling Harbour, either by Monorail, walking or taxi.
